channel.title: PortForwarding And Changing IP Problem
channel.description: [table] [tr] [td][/td] [/tr] [/table] Well, i cant portforward on the portforward site, and there isnt a 127.0.0.1 in my egui file. is there any other ways to portforward, easy ways please?

item.title: PortForwarding And Changing IP Problem
item.dc:creator: @demolitiond demolitiond
item.description:
@demolitiond wrote:

Go to www.no-ip.com and make an account. Once you’ve done that you need to click add a host, when your choosing your domain make sure you choose something with no-ip in it for example: nameofyourserver.no-ip.biz. Once you have done this you need to download no-ip DUC, you’ll find it on their download page, just click what system your using and download it. Once its downloaded, install and run. It will ask you to enter your username and password that you used to register on the site with, enter it and that should be it. NOTE: you need to change your client ip to what ever no-ip domain you chose.

If you need anymore help just let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: PortForwarding And Changing IP Problem
item.dc:creator: @Delta1wolf Delta1wolf
item.description:
@Delta1wolf wrote:

[quote=“demolitiond, post:4, topic:359691”]ok, you see the three “” “” “” inbetween each of them Type it out your ip or no-ip address here is an example:

“example.no-ip.biz” “example.no-ip.biz” “example.no-ip.biz”

Save it, then compile.

let me know if this worked[/quote]

Yh, i cant connect on my client, now so i think thats done the trick, but the thing is i know why it says error is because my 43594 isnt opened, i have tried utorrent, but the thing is i dont now how to get a static ip so i dont know if the www.portforward.com tutorial will help because i didnt know the static ip.
Please
replyy and if i ever get my server started i will give you admin

Read full topic

item.title: PortForwarding And Changing IP Problem
item.dc:creator: @Delta1wolf Delta1wolf
item.description:
@Delta1wolf wrote:

[quote=“demolitiond, post:2, topic:359691”][quote author=Delta1wolf link=topic=456133.msg3339299#msg3339299 date=1284221831]
[table]
[tr]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]
Well, i cant portforward on the portforward site, and there isnt a 127.0.0.1 in my egui file.
is there any other ways to portforward, easy ways please?
[/quote]

Its not always “127.0.0.1” could be “localhost” or a different ip. go into your EGUI or GUI and type ctrl + h and search for serverip or you can just search ip then put your ip or your no-ip (e.g joeblogs.no-ip.biz) in between the “”

Hope this helped[/quote]

This is what happens when i go in the egui.java file…
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“”, “”, “”
});
}
}

item.title: PortForwarding And Changing IP Problem
item.dc:creator: @demolitiond demolitiond
item.description:
@demolitiond wrote:

[quote=“Delta1wolf, post:1, topic:359691”][table]
[tr]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]
Well, i cant portforward on the portforward site, and there isnt a 127.0.0.1 in my egui file.
is there any other ways to portforward, easy ways please?[/quote]

Its not always “127.0.0.1” could be “localhost” or a different ip. go into your EGUI or GUI and type ctrl + h and search for serverip or you can just search ip then put your ip or your no-ip (e.g joeblogs.no-ip.biz) in between the “”

Hope this helped
